biweekly.io

Class StreamWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.StreamWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ICalWriter, JCalWriter, XCalDocument.XCalDocumentStreamWriter, XCalWriter

    public abstract class StreamWriter
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Writes iCalendar objects to a data stream.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(ICalendar ical)
           throws IOException
        Writes an iCalendar object to the data stream.
        Parameters:
        ical - the iCalendar object to write
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the scribe class for a component or property object cannot be found (only happens when an experimental property/component scribe is not registered with the registerScribe method.)
        IOException - if there's a problem writing to the data stream

      • getTargetVersion

        protected abstract ICalVersion getTargetVersion()
        Gets the version that the next iCalendar object will be written as.
        Returns:
        the version

      • _write

        protected abstract void _write(ICalendar ical)
                        throws IOException
        Writes an iCalendar object to the data stream.
        Parameters:
        ical - the iCalendar object to write
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem writing to the data stream

      • getTimezoneInfo

        public TimezoneInfo getTimezoneInfo()
        Gets the timezone-related info for this writer.
        Returns:
        the timezone-related info

      • setTimezoneInfo

        public void setTimezoneInfo(TimezoneInfo tzinfo)
        Sets the timezone-related info for this writer.
        Parameters:
        tzinfo - the timezone-related info

      • registerScribe

        public void registerScribe(ICalPropertyScribe<? extends ICalProperty> scribe)

        Registers an experimental property scribe. Can also be used to override the scribe of a standard property (such as DTSTART). Calling this method is the same as calling:

        getScribeIndex().register(scribe).

        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe to register

      • registerScribe

        public void registerScribe(ICalComponentScribe<? extends ICalComponent> scribe)

        Registers an experimental component scribe. Can also be used to override the scribe of a standard component (such as VEVENT). Calling this method is the same as calling:

        getScribeIndex().register(scribe).

        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe to register

      • getScribeIndex

        public ScribeIndex getScribeIndex()
        Gets the object that manages the component/property scribes.
        Returns:
        the scribe index

      • setScribeIndex

        public void setScribeIndex(ScribeIndex scribe)
        Sets the object that manages the component/property scribes.
        Parameters:
        scribe - the scribe index
